dcterms:creator: Nitish Srivastava
Elman Mansimov
Ruslan Salakhudinov
dcterms:description: The moving MNIST dataset serves as a benchmark synthetic dataset for evaluating sequence prediction models. Each sequence comprises 20 frames, with the initial 10 frames for input and the subsequent 10 frames as the prediction target.
dcterms:title: Moving MNIST

dcterms:creator: Christian Schuldt
Ivan Laptev
Barbara Caputo
dcterms:description: The KTH dataset contains 25 individuals performing six types of human actions in 4 different scenarios. It is used for action recognition tasks.
dcterms:title: KTH

dcterms:creator: Junbo Zhang
Yu Zheng
Dekang Qi
dcterms:description: TaxiBJ includes GPS data from taxis and meteorological data in Beijing, visualized as a heatmap representing traffic inflow and outflow. It is used for traffic flow prediction.
dcterms:title: TaxiBJ
